result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles J. Clark

defendant.name: Clark, Charles J.

records.addlTxt: 11:09 AM Defendant Charles J. Clark in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul Edward Zilles appeared by video for Charles J. Clark.  Attorney Elysia Nguyen in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Zilles requests bond modification. Requests signature bond for defendant to go to treatment. State objects. Court denies bond modification however once there is availability in the facility and the defendant is qualified Atty Zilles can file a stipulation. Adj: 11:24 am
Final Pre-Trial Scheduling Order

Jury trial on December 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Further proceedings on October 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Deft appears while in custody from Outagamie County Jail. Defendant does not want to proceed with plea. Court will adjourn. Further Proceedings, Final PTC and JT dates set.

NOT ON RECORD - JA TOOK UP. Defendant Charles J. Clark not in court in custody at Outagamie County Jail.  Attorney Paul Edward Zilles in court for Charles J. Clark.  Prosecuting attorney Rodman Wells Streicher in court for the State of Wisconsin. Will resolve, received revised global offer, needs time to discuss with defendant. In contemplation of PSI. Plea Hearing date set, in person.
Plea hearing on October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Deft appears while in custody from Outagamie County Jail.  Reading of Information waived - NG pleas entered - PTC date scheduled.
and Motion for Pretrial Orders - Atty Kudek
Deft appears while in custody. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court advises Defendant of rights. Court finds probable cause and binds case over for arraignment to Branch 2.
Arraignment on July 18, 2022 at 09:15 am.
-Atty Zilles

Outagamie County PSA Report

The defendant shall appear on all court dates; give written notice to the Clerk of Court  within 48 hours of any change of address or telephone number;  shall not commit any crime; shall neither directly nor indirectly threaten, harass, intimidate or otherwise interfere with victims or witnesses in this action.  Call the Outagamie County Sheriff's Dept. at (920) 832-5633 within 48 hours for fingerprints and/or photos (to be completed within 21 days).  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety for pendency of case, except for prescribed medication.  The Defendant is to report to Pretrial Services Level 3, random UA's.
Deft appears while in custody via video.  Preliminary hearing scheduled within 20 days.
Preliminary hearing on June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
